author: R Sivaraman
text:
To review election preparednessfor the Assembly elections

The Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) will be visiting Puducherry on Tuesday and Wednesday for an exhaustive review of election preparedness for the forthcoming Assembly polls.

As part of its review of election preparedness in poll-bound states, the Election Commission has already visited Kerala and interacted with officers of the State administration and other stakeholders, including political parties.

‘Full’ Commission

The ‘full’ Commission comprising Chief Election Commissioner Nasim Zaidi and Commissioners A.K.Joti and O.P. Rawat will arrive at Puducherry on Tuesday and will leave for Chennai on February 10.

During the visit, the commission will work along with the Chief Electoral Officer V. Candavelou and the State police nodal officer and Deputy Inspector General of Police Kannan Jagadeesan on Tuesday.

On the following day, the commission is scheduled to meet the representatives of recognised political parties to elicit their view and suggestion for conducting free and fair elections.

Meeting of Collectors

That will be followed by a meeting of District Collectors of Puducherry and Karaikal and Senior Superintendents of Police of those districts. Electoral Registration officers and Assistant Electoral Registration officers are likely to take part in the meeting.

Later, the commission will hold a high level meeting with Chief Secretary Manoj Parida, Chief Electoral Officer V. Candavelou, Inspector General of Police Praveeer Ranjan on various issues concerning the conduct of election and election management.

The commission is scheduled to meet the representatives of recognised political parties
title: CEC to visit Puducherry today
